result.execSummary:
The defendant Rudolph R Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitled to 31 days presentence credit IF revoked.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within 60 days (6/24/22) unless a payment plan has been established.
Defendant to pay restitution and all applicable fees and surcharges through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within 60 days (6/24/22) unless a payment plan has been established.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom. 

Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling/treatment as recommended by Agent.

Defendant shall not go on the premises of victim businesses in 21CF369 and 22CF99.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. 

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

9:42 AM 21CF258, 21CF369, 22CF34, 22CF99: Defendant Rudolph R Jackson in court, in custody.  Attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde in court for Rudolph R Jackson. Def. will plead today; State heard on recomm.; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charges/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Poss. of Cocaine2+/Repeater in Count 3 of 21CF258, Def. pleads NC to Felony BJ (Repeater STRICKEN) in Count 1 of 21CF369 and pleads NC to Felony BJ (Repeater STRICKEN) in Count 1 of 22CF99; stip. to facts; Court finds pleas made FV&I and Court finds Def. guilty of Poss. of Cocaine2+/Repeater in 21CF258, guilty of Felony BJ (Repeater STRICKEN) in Count 1 of 21CF369 & 22CF99 w/all other counts D&RI; victim rights complied with; State heard; Atty. Van Kerkvoorde heard; Court imposes sentence; Atty. Van Kerkvoorde to supply credit slip, requests 19 days in 21CF258, 20 days in 21CF369 and 31 days in 22CF99

21CF258, Count 3: Poss. of Cocaine2+/Repeater - credit is held open on same
**W/H - 3 years PO

21CF369, Count 1: Felony BJ - 20 days credit if revoked
**W/H 3 years PO
- 90 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. to comm. forthwith

22CF99, Count 1: Felony BJ - 31 days credit if revoked
**W/H - 3 years PO
- $291.86 Restitution to Victim

Cond. of PO:
- $288 CC each count
- $250 DNA surcharge/sample each count
- shall not go on the premises of victim business in 21CF369 and 22CF99
- AODA & FT
- participate in any counseling/treatment as recomm. by Agent.
- absolute sobriety, no bars
- no drugs, etc.

12:54 PM Defendant Rudolph R Jackson in court, in custody with attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde (eligible).  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1,000 Cash bond with conditions:   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim business.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
